sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Generates an array of uniformly distributed integers between the two supplied limits. The general syntax for randi is y = randi(low,high) where low and high are arrays of integers. Scalars can be used for one of the arguments. The output y is a uniformly distributed pseudo-random number between low and high (inclusive).

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: Here is an example of a set of random integers between zero and 5:
